variants.Description in input context: This variant affects GTPase activity and dimerization in the COR domain of LRRK2.

Material used.Description: GTPase activity was measured in lysates from cells expressing wild-type and mutant LRRK2.

Readout description.Result Description: GTPase activity was decreased by 40% in cells expressing the Y1699C mutant.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was measured in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Lysates from untransfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: GTPase activity greater than 80% of wild-type levels

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: GTPase activity less than 50% of wild-type levels

Material used.Description: Dimerization was analyzed using co-immunoprecipitation and Western blotting.

Readout description.Result Description: The Y1699C mutant formed less stable dimers compared to wild-type LRRK2.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was measured in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Lysates from untransfected cells were used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Dimer formation detectable by Western blot
